title: Brazil floods leave cutoff survivors scrambling for supplies
description: Hundreds of residents of a rain-battered region in Brazil’s Sao Paulo state are scrambling to find water and daily supplies after floods and mudslides cut off their communities and left at least 48 people dead

title: Police: Haitian gang member detained in Dominican Republic
description: Authorities say a Haitian man believed to be a member of the gang involved in the recent killings of six Haitian police officers has been arrested in the neighboring Dominican Republic and deported

title: Off-duty police officer shot and wounded in Northern Ireland
description: An off-duty police officer has been shot in Northern Ireland, where paramilitary groups have previously attacked members of the security services

title: A global divide on the Ukraine war is deepening
description: Beyond the West, the world is far from united on the issues raised by the Ukraine war and Russia often gets a sympathetic hearing in the Global South.

title: U.S. releases photo of Chinese balloon captured by U-2 spy plane
description: The imagery, captured by a U-2 spy plane, was released more than two weeks after the U.S. military downed the Chinese balloon off the coast of South Carolina.

title: Wagner mercenary boss and Russian military chiefs at war — with each other
description: Yevgeniy Prigozhin, who leads Russia’s Wagner mercenary group, harshly criticized top military officials, as battlefield losses in Ukraine set off nasty in-fighting.

title: A timeline of recent escalating violence between Israelis and Palestinians
description: In the occupied West Bank, daily Israeli incursions have become the norm, some leading to deadly gun battles.

title: Russian propagandists are buying Twitter blue-check verifications
description: As the Ukraine war enters its second year, the presence of accounts pushing Russian propaganda on Twitter has skyrocketed.

title: What's behind the Israeli army's deadly Nablus arrest raid?
description: The heart of the West Bank city of Nablus, the Palestinian commercial center, is in ruins after a daytime Israeli military triggered a firefight that killed at least 10 Palestinians and wounded more than 100 others

title: Pope at Lent's start: end 'dictatorship' of the superficial
description: Pope Francis has ushered in the solemn Christian Lenten period of sacrifice and reflection by encouraging people to cast off what he called the “dictatorship” of heavy agendas and superficial needs

title: Iconic Slovenian band Laibach to perform in Ukraine amid war
description: Slovenia’s iconic band Laibach will hold a concert in Ukraine’s capital next month, saying this will make them the first foreign band to perform a full show in Kyiv since the beginning of Russia’s invasion last February

title: US sanctions Mexican drug precursor suppliers
description: The U.S. Treasury Department has slapped sanctions on six members of a Mexican ring accused of supplying massive amounts of precursor chemical used to make deadly fentanyl and methamphetamines

title: What are Articles 4 and 5 of NATO’s founding treaty and why do they matter?
description: President Biden told Eastern European leaders the United States had made a "sacred commitment" to Article 5 of the NATO charter.

title: Mexican president hopes ex security chief will turn informer
description: Mexico’s president says he hopes that former security chief Genaro Garc�a Luna will turn state’s evidence in the U.S. and perhaps implicate former Mexican presidents

title: Small plane crashes in western Slovakia, 4 killed
description: Slovakia’s rescue service says a small plane has crashed in the western part of the country, killing four people on board

title: Simone Segouin, French resistance fighter, dies at 97
description: “It’s true, the Germans were our enemies, it was the war, but I don’t draw any pride from it,” she later said.

title: International journalists federation suspends Russian union
description: The International Federation of Journalists has suspended with immediate effect the Russian Union of Journalists over its action since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and its role in annexed Ukrainian territories

title: At least 10 Palestinians killed, over 100 wounded in Israeli raid in the West Bank
description: The raid on Nablus. one of the deadliest operations in 20 years, comes just a month after an equally deadly raid on the West Bank city of Jenin in an escalating cycle of violence between Israelis and Palestinians.

title: Horn of Africa drought trends said worse than in 2011 famine
description: A climate center says the trends in a historic Horn of Africa drought are worse than they were in a 2011 drought in which at least a quarter-million people died

title: Taiwan frustrated by weapons delays, key lawmaker finds in stealth visit
description: Rep. Mike Gallagher, chairman of the new House select committee on China, said Russia’s invasion of Ukraine was a 'wake-up call' for Taipei.

title: Weakened Cyclone Freddy batters Madagascar, killing 4
description: A weakened Cyclone Freddy which pummeled Madagascar Tuesday night with heavy rains and strong destructive winds has killed four people and is continuing to wreak havoc in the southwest of the Indian Ocean nation

title: Dutch end probe into supply of arms for 2015 Paris attacks
description: Dutch prosecutors have dropped their case against a man who had been suspected of involvement in supplying automatic weapons to Islamic State extremists who went on a bloody rampage in Paris in 2015

title: German town sees blowback over relocations for refugees
description: An official says that a German town’s decision to relocate about 40 residents from their apartments to temporarily house refugees there has generated hundreds of hate mails and thousands of calls

title: France: Teacher stabbed to death by high school student
description: French authorities and media reports say a teacher has been stabbed to death in southwestern France by a high school student

title: Ukrainians reflect on a year of loss, unity and fear
description: Since Russia launched its full-scale invasion on Ukraine one year ago, every Ukrainian’s life has changed — in ways both big and small.

title: Latin Grammys to be held in Spain, leaving US for 1st time
description: The next Latin Grammy Awards gala will be held in southern Spain, leaving the United States for the first time

title: Pakistan defense minister in Kabul over shut border crossing
description: Pakistani officials say the country’s defense minister is in Afghanistan and has met with Taliban officials in an effort to resolve the closure of a key border crossing between the two neighboring states

title: A year later, China blames U.S. ‘hegemony’ — not Russia — for war in Ukraine
description: China's top diplomat, Wang Yi, is in Moscow ahead of the first anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine and meeting with President Vladimir Putin.

title: At least 2 dead, more than 50 missing in China mine collapse
description: Chinese state media are reporting at least two people have died and more than 50 are missing following a collapse at an open pit mine in the country’s northern Inner Mongolia region

title: Ex-ISIS teen bride Shamima Begum loses appeal to regain U.K. citizenship
description: Britain has called her a threat to national security, but she maintains she was groomed and lured by Islamic State recruiters when she was a child.

title: Russian lawmakers endorse suspension of nuclear pact with US
description: The lower house of tje Russian parliament has quickly endorsed President Vladimir Putin’s move to suspend the last remaining nuclear arms treaty with the United States

title: ‘Now or never’: Young Nigerians pin hopes on key election
description: As Nigeria prepares for its presidential election this weekend, younger voters are mobilizing in record numbers to take part

title: Palestinians: 2 killed in Israeli army raid in West Bank
description: Palestinian officials say that two Palestinians were killed and more than two dozen were wounded during a daytime Israeli army arrest raid in the occupied West Bank

title: Spain: police detain father of 2 sisters slain in Pakistan
description: Police in Spain have detained the father of two sisters who were victims of so-called “honor killings” while visiting family in Pakistan

title: Germany expels 2 Iranian diplomats over death sentence
description: Germany says it is expelling two Iranian diplomats over the death sentence imposed in Iran against one of its citizens

title: South Korea just set a fertility record (but not in a good way)
description: South Korea’s fertility rate fell to a record low for the seventh straight year and is far below the “replacement level” needed to keep the population stable.

title: Poland is on a quest to have Europe’s strongest military — with U.S. arms
description: Poland's defense minister hopes to build “the largest land force in Europe,” and Warsaw has been signing billions in weapons contracts with U.S. suppliers.

title: Global impact: 5 ways war in Ukraine has changed the world
description: War has been a catastrophe for Ukraine and a crisis for the globe

title: Germany's military 'turning point' still a work in progress
description: Nearly a year after Chancellor Olaf Scholz declared Russia’s invasion of Ukraine a “turning point” that would trigger a massive increase in Germany’s military spending, the turnaround for his country’s armed forces still has a long way to go

title: Russia, blaming U.S. sabotage, calls for U.N. probe of Nord Stream
description: Moscow cited independent journalist Seymour Hersh’s account — vociferously denied by the White House — as evidence. Washington says the Kremlin is just trying to divert attention from its crimes in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Biden to meet Russia’s NATO neighbors in Poland as war nears one year
description: Biden will meet with the Bucharest Nine, a group of eastern NATO countries concerned by Russian aggression, and Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg in Warsaw.

title: Somali security forces end al-Shabab siege that killed 10
description: Security forces in Somalia have ended a siege by al-Shabab extremists that killed 10 people and wounded three others at a home in the capital, Mogadishu

title: Philippine police hunting killers of New Zealand tourist
description: Philippine police officials say a search is underway for two motorcycle-riding men who shot and killed a New Zealand man in a brazen street robbery that officials fear could scare foreign tourists away

title: A year in the trenches has hardened Ukraine’s president
description: Volodymyr Zelensky came into office thinking peace with Putin was possible. He now believes victory is the only answer.

title: Biden rallies the West, but what about the rest?
description: New polling shows U.S. and E.U. public attitudes reinforce President Biden’s rhetoric on Ukraine, but it found different attitudes in China, Turkey and India.
